titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Japanese Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual, Transgender, and Queer Collection
Japanese Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual, Transgender, and Queer Collection
titlestmt.author: compiled by Caitlin Casiello and Haruko Nakamura

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Friday November 30, 2018 at 08:16

did.unittitle: Japanese lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, and queer collection

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract:
The collection consists of fliers, newsletters, brochures, and other educational material published and distributed by Japanese lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, and queer (LGBTQ) organizations, primarily from the Tokyo area. Materials focus on gay and bisexual men's health, sexually transmitted infection (STI) prevention and testing, and community activities for HIV positive individuals. The collection includes publications documenting bars and clubs, community spaces and support services, art and cultural events, and political activism, as well as newsletters from over thirty LGBTQ organizations located in Tokyo and other regions of Japan. Materials date from 1993 to 2016.
このコレクションは日本、主に東京首都圏の性的少数派 （ＬＧＢＴＱ: レズビアン、ゲイ、バイセクシュアル、トランスジェンダー、そしてクィア）などの団体によって２０００年代から現在までに配布されたチラシ、ニュースレター、パンフレットなどの収集を目的とする。最初のシリーズにはゲイやバイセクシャルの男性の健康、ＨＩＶなどの性感染症（ＳＴＩ）の予防とテスト、および生活とコミュニティを取り巻く資料が含まれ、広範な内容となっている。それに加えゲイやバイセクシャルの男性に主に焦点を当てたバーやクラブ、コミュニティスペースと支援、芸術や文化イベント、および政治的行動のための出版物で構成されている。第二シリーズは３０以上の東京及び他の地域からで活動しているＬＧＢＴＱ団体のニュースレターが収められる。

langmaterial.language: The material is in Japanese and English.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of fliers, newsletters, brochures, and other educational material published and distributed by Japanese lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, and queer (LGBTQ) organizations, primarily from the Tokyo area. Materials focus on gay and bisexual men's health, sexually transmitted infection (STI) prevention and testing, and community activities for HIV positive individuals. The collection includes publications documenting bars and clubs, community spaces and support services, art and cultural events, and political activism, as well as newsletters from over thirty LGBTQ organizations located in Tokyo and other regions of Japan. Materials date from 1993 to 2016.

このコレクションは日本、主に東京首都圏の性的少数派 （ＬＧＢＴＱ: レズビアン、ゲイ、バイセクシュアル、トランスジェンダー、そしてクィア）などの団体によって２０００年代から現在までに配布されたチラシ、ニュースレター、パンフレットなどの収集を目的とする。最初のシリーズにはゲイやバイセクシャルの男性の健康、ＨＩＶなどの性感染症（ＳＴＩ）の予防とテスト、および生活とコミュニティを取り巻く資料が含まれ、広範な内容となっている。それに加えゲイやバイセクシャルの男性に主に焦点を当てたバーやクラブ、コミュニティスペースと支援、芸術や文化イベント、および政治的行動のための出版物で構成されている。第二シリーズは３０以上の東京及び他の地域からで活動しているＬＧＢＴＱ団体のニュースレターが収められる。

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Transferred from the Librarian for Japanese Studies, 2016. Materials were collected in collaboration with Yoshie Yanagihara of Tokyo Denki University, Tetsuyuki Shida of Waseda University, and Community Center Akta, a nonprofit organization established for HIV/AIDS awareness.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright status for collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Japanese Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual, Transgender, and Queer Collection (MS 2067). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged in two series: I. General publications, 1993-2016. II. Newsletters, 2008-2016.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series I consists of fliers, brochures, advertisements, and other publications. Materials focus primarily on gay and bisexual men. Since materials may cover more than one subject, it is recommended that researchers looking for particular types of material examine related topics.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Materials are arranged alphabetically by subject.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series II consists of newsletters and community papers from LGBTQ organizations located in Tokyo and other regions of Japan. The name of the organization that created and/or provided the newsletter are included in the inventory.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The series is arranged alphabetically by title of newsletter.
